SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To describe a patient with Behcet disease who developed a pathergy-like reaction following intravitreal triamcinolone acetonide injection
RESULTS: A 30-year-old man with a history of Behçet disease received an intravitreal injection of triamcinolone acetonide for the treatment of cystoid macular edema
The following day, he was noted to have erythematous swelling around the injection site
The lesion disappeared spontaneously within 2 weeks
CONCLUSION: Pathergy-like reaction to minor trauma may develop not only on the skin but also in the mucous membranes such as conjunctiva in patients with Behçet disease
